critical.title: Timing Attack Vulnerability in Signature Comparison
critical.description: HMAC signature verification uses non-timing-safe comparison operator (===) instead of crypto.timingSafeEqual()

exploit.method: Timing attack to brute-force HMAC signature byte-by-byte
exploit.impact: Attacker can forge ACK messages and disrupt CFN Loop coordination
exploit.demonstration: Test shows measurable timing differences in comparison (304ns to 1189ns variance)

codeEvidence.comment: // Use timing-safe comparison to prevent timing attacks
codeEvidence.issue: Comment claims timing-safe, but === is NOT timing-safe

high.title: Broken Secret Management - randomBytes() Fallback
high.cwe: CWE-321: Use of Hard-coded Cryptographic Key
high.description: HMAC secret falls back to randomBytes(32) if env var not set, making signatures unverifiable across coordinator instances

exploit.method: Each coordinator generates different random secret, cannot verify each other's ACKs
exploit.impact: Distributed ACK verification completely broken - coordinators reject all ACKs from other instances
exploit.demonstration: Test shows different random secrets produce incompatible signatures

codeEvidence.issue: randomBytes() creates instance-specific secret, breaking distributed verification

remediation.required: Require shared secret - throw error if not provided
remediation.deployment: Document secret management in deployment guide
remediation.testing: Test multi-coordinator setup with shared secret

productionImpact.current: ACK verification non-functional in distributed deployments
productionImpact.afterFix: All coordinators share secret and can verify ACKs

medium.title: No Secret Rotation Mechanism
medium.description: No mechanism to rotate HMAC secret if compromised - all coordinators must restart

exploit.method: If secret is leaked, cannot rotate without full system restart
exploit.impact: Extended exposure window if secret is compromised

design.rotation: Support multiple versions during transition period

medium.title: No Secret Validation on Startup
medium.cwe: CWE-754: Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions
medium.description: No validation that all coordinators share same secret - mismatched secrets undetected

exploit.method: Coordinator runs with wrong secret, silently rejects all ACKs
exploit.impact: Silent ACK verification failures, debugging difficulty

remediation.required: Add startup handshake to verify secret match

design.handshake: Coordinators exchange test signatures on startup
design.validation: Verify test signature with shared secret
design.errorHandling: Fail fast if secret mismatch detected

emptyValidation.evidence: Rejects empty/null/undefined - prevents null byte injection
